title: Hurricane Maria had a significant impact on HIV care outcomes

title_detail.value: Hurricane Maria had a significant impact on HIV care outcomes

summary: Hurricane Maria in San Juan, Puerto Rico had a significant impact on HIV outcomes among people living with HIV and a history of substance use, particularly increased viral load and decreased CD4 counts. The average viral load following the Hurricane was significantly (11 percent) higher compared to the pre-Hurricane Maria viral load assessment.
